main event: Mr. W. C. Eidson reported observing an unidentified aerial object hovering in the sky near McDonough, Georgia, on December 6, 1951.
interesting points: The object was round or elliptical in shape and emitted a reddish-orange glow., It appeared approximately the size of a basketball at arm's length., The object remained stationary for about two minutes before accelerating and disappearing., The investigation concluded the object was a natural phenomenon, possibly a planet or bright star., The case was officially classified as UNIDENTIFIED.
witness description: Mr. W. C. Eidson, while driving on U.S. Highway 23.
